cards.desc:
During the Newton release cycle, centralize and review 100% of configuration defaults across OSIC projects* and set applicable defaults to operational best practices while maintaining defcore compliance.**

[Centralize Config User Story (in review)](https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291406/)
cards.name: CFGDFT -- Centralize configuration defaults

cards.desc: Open-source an inventory management operations/fleet management service to the community during the Mitaka release cycle AND auditing and resolving open-source operations/fleet management services in the Newton release cycle.
cards.name: FLTMGT - Establish operations/fleet management in the community

cards.desc: During the Newton release recruit OpenStack novices from classes of recent OSIC graduates and recruited third party sys-admins, follow them as they install OpenStack using only reference implementation and documentation. Provide a lifeline via named support in the #osic channel where we provide expertise and help where needed to complete the install. Document pain points and improve the process towards the goal of a 88 node install taking X hours during the Newton release cycle
cards.name: NOVEXP - Document and improve novice experience

cards.desc: During the Newton release cycle, add a rolling upgrade third party multi-node CI to one Deployment and LCM Project which validates rolling-upgrades on our reference implementation
cards.name: MULTCI -- Establish a rolling upgrade multi-node CI

cards.desc: During the Newton release cycle, add Neutron, Cinder, Glance, Heat and Keystone to the list of "assert:supports-rolling-upgrade" and validate
cards.name: RLGUPD -- Add rolling upgrade capabilities to additional projectts

cards.desc: During or soon after the Newton release cycle, demonstrate upgradability of a 88-node environment deploying 6 core services*** with 100% data plane uptime with 99% success rate during a 2 hour control-plane downtime window
cards.name: DEMOUG -- Demonstrate platform upgradability

cards.desc:
During the Newton release cycle, create feature classification framework[4] across core services*** and seed with two common configurations.

[Feature Classification Framework User Story (in review)](https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291298/)
cards.name: FEATCL --- Create Feature Classification Framework

cards.desc: During the Newton release cycle, improve the Syntribos tool to provide support for all core OSIC projects*** in order to provide a common API security testing tool.
cards.name: SECTST -- Establish a common API Security Testing Tool

cards.desc: During the Newton release cycle, ensure the cloud portion (reference implementation deployment) portion of the OSIC cluster maintains 99.99% control plane availability outside of regular maintenance periods and baseline data-plane availabilty.
cards.name: CPNAVL -- Monitor and Improve Control Plane availability

cards.desc: During the Newton release cycle, deploy reference implementation OpenStack at 22 hosts and apply continual load while growing to 600 hosts without downtime. Document and distribute operational best practices.
cards.name: LODTST -- Establish and document continuous load testing

cards.desc: During the Newton release cycle, deploy and integrate commenting performance third party CI and provide benchmarks for common metrics across all OSIC projects
cards.name: THRDCI -- Deploy and integrate a third party CI for benchmarking

cards.desc: During the Newton release cycle, improve Swift time to first byte by 20%
cards.name: SWFTTM -- Improve Swift time to first byte

cards.desc:
Abstract:
Assemble an OpenStack cluster and perform benchmarking. Identify and attempt to diagnose bottlenecks. Attempt to identify optimal tunings at that size, and recommend for the OpenStack Telemetry community areas for continued optimization as appropriate. Multiple configurations to test, as time allows, would include Ceilometer with(out) Gnocchi, Gnocchi using each of: File, Ceph, Swift, and InfluxDB storage engines.
cards.name: GNOBEN -- Benchmark Gnocchi
CEIDOC -- Review and update or expand administrators and operators guides for Ceilometer

cards.desc: The current Ironic plugin for Horizon <https://launchpad.net/ironic-ui> has minimal functionality and needs usability and other polishing work. The project has its own etherpad of tasks: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-plugin-roadmap-v2
cards.name: IRNPLG -- Ironic plugin improvements

cards.desc:
This is the example card:
Description of the Functionality and User Benefit that is provided by this Epic/task once completed. 
Trello Card rules 
--1-- Every card belongs to an Epic.  Epics are the "big goals" for Newton that Kenny asked folks to break down and those you and your team are proposing.  
--2-- Every Epic has a six-character, all-cap mnemonic.  So the Epic to build a new widget might be NEWWGT.
 
--3-- Every card name is prefixed with the Epic mnemonic, so the card to write the widget's scheduling logic might be named "NEWWGT - Build scheduling logic".  We'll use this instead of the parent-child card relationships found in a tool like Jira.
Secondary Cards Need this card Title to reference the "EPIC" card on the left column of the trello board 

At least Initially this work breakdown assumes that the work will be completed in the next "Newton" release cycle
cards.name: Example: Work Breakdown SWFTTM - Draft Spec for submission

cards.desc:
Design the architecture for the deployment specifying 
 - what tooling and/or guides will be used to facilitate the deploy
 - what infrastructural/Openstack services are to be deployed and which are to be omitted
 - where, and with what multiplicity, each service will be deployed
 - networks configuration specification (control plane, data plane(s)?)
 - disk configuration (disk partition plan, mount points, RAID levels)

members.bio:
I sneeze loud.

Job: Rackspace Product Manager
IRC: kencjohnston
gChat: kencjohnston
Skype: kenny.c.johnston
Mobile: +1 7853834044
Location: Kansas City
TZ: US Central

Datacenter Software Planner in Intel's Open Source Technology Center. Been working exclusively in OpenStack space for 2 years - started with marketing to the community and training the Intel field. Completed 16 years at Intel, mostly in technology enabling programs (outreach to SW vendors)

Manager, Software Development, UK
Rackspace Private Cloud

Working on Ops Tooling for Private and Public Cloud.

Inventory
Remediation
Auditing
Alert Aggregation
Miscellaneous other stuff which I can't remember

card.name: GNOBEN [Ceilometer] -- Ansible role for production/scale testing deployments
GNOBEN [Ceilometer] -- Ansible role for production/scale testing deployments

data.text:
Most all of the implementation steps listed here were initially completed during the Mitaka cycle but changes to the OpenStack-Ansible project (especially Independant Role Repositories specs) blocked acceptance and merge of this role.

Each of the implementation steps will require some new work to integrate the Gnocchi role with the current best-practices used within the OpenStack-Ansible project as they have changed since the initial solution was drafted, and there have been many changes in the Gnocchi project as well mandating thorough review and updates to the deployment role before the OpenStack-Ansible community will accept and merge the implementation.

data.text:
This has been a community priority, and some efforts have been made to date leading to improvements but as many issues have been found readily through these benchmarking efforts additional resources are desired by the community. 

The Mitaka summit's priorities etherpad includes this task, not marked as done:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-telemetry-todos

it is carried over to Newton planning:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-telemetry-summit-planning
Attached an existing community document describing the sort of scale testing desired.
